plugins.name: Zebra Code
plugins.description:
Introducing the Zebra Code plugin for Figma, a powerful tool to generate various types of barcodes and QR codes directly within your Figma projects. Zebra Code supports multiple barcode formats, including QR CODE, UPC A, UPC E, EAN 8, EAN 13, CODE 39, CODE 93, CODE 128, CODABAR, INTERLEAVED 2 5, STANDARD 2 5, MSI CHECKSUM, POSTNET, PLANET, RMS4CC, and KIX.


Tutorial:


  1. Install the Zebra Code plugin in Figma.
  2. Open the plugin in the Figma sidebar by navigating to the Plugins menu and selecting Zebra Code.
  3. Click on a text node in your design or type your desired text into the input field in the plugin UI.
  4. Choose the desired barcode type from the dropdown menu.
  5. Click the "Generate" button to create the barcode. The plugin will generate the barcode and insert it into a frame within your Figma document.
  6. Adjust the position and size of the generated barcode frame as needed.


You can learn more about the API used in this plugin on the following page.

accepted.name: Muhibbudin Suretno
accepted.description: Explore the convergence of imagination and innovation, as we mold your visions into digital masterpieces.

plugins.tagline: Generate various Barcodes and QR with Zebra Code, we supports multiple barcodes formats.

plugins.name: Rapidream - Fully Responsive Code!
plugins.description:
The #1 Figma-to-React plugin.


Use Rapidream with any design! No auto-layout required!


Design for one device size and Rapidream will apply full responsiveness across all devices.


"Is this a bad joke? How is it possible?" you may ask.


No joke. It's possible because Rapidream:


  1. ðŸ§¹ First cleans up the design, removing and merging tons of nodes (without changing your copy of course)
  2. ðŸªº Figures out the CORRECT nesting and ordering of every element to allow true responsiveness and a clean DOM tree
  3. ðŸŒ´ Lets you easily edit the generated DOM tree... while recalculating all the responsive styles in real time!! (we get the code 90% there and make it super easy to finish the last 10%)


Rapidream is best suited for developers working on serious web applications. Landing pages and other design-heavy stuff will also work but is not currently our main focus.


Sign up at app.rapidream.com, and join our (growing) Discord - we'd really love to hear from you!


P.S. The beautiful Figma design above was made by holomusic.co and converted to React by Rapidream.

accepted.description: A Figma-to-React tool built BY Front-End devs FOR Front-End devs.

plugins.name: Paddi
plugins.description:
â– OVERVIEW
Paddi helps you to set paddings for a Group, a Frame, or a Component. When you specify the padding values in the component name you can change the elements inside the component and apply the paddings in one click. The component will automatically resize itself so that it surrounds all other elements within the component according to padding values.

Specify the padding values within the component group or frame name. E.g. button [12 24]. The format of the padding values is in the same order as CSS.

â– FEATURES
âœ… Paddi works with Groups, Frames, Components, Libraries.
âœ… Paddi is simple! The only thing you need to do is specify the paddings in the component name
âœ… Recognize components with paddings looking at their names. âš¡ï¸ It works the same as in CSS.
âœ… Paddi is flexible. No limitation there, set the same padding for all sides [12] or different for each one [12 24 14 32].
âœ… Paddi uses a base element as a parent and calculates paddings from it.
âœ… Speed up your workflow! You donâ€™t need to open plugin settings all the time you need to update paddings. You only need to rename the component and run the Paddi.
âœ… Natural master & instance behavior. If you change master component paddings, you donâ€™t need to do anything else to update instances, Paddi will update all instances automatically.
âœ… Paddi works with libraries. Create a master component in your library file and apply the padding for all its instances in any project file. âš ï¸ If you change padding for the master component in the library you will have to update all instances in the other files manually.

â– PADDINGS
Padding values sets by clockwise from top to left sides. It works the same as in CSS. Examples:
- [12] - padding for all sides - 12px
- [12 24] - top&bottom - 12px, right&left - 24 px
- [12 24 32] - top - 12px, right&left - 24px, bottom - 32px
- [12 24 32 16] - top - 12px, right - 24px, bottom - 32px, left - 16px

â– FORMATS
We recommend to use space for separating padding values to keep it simple, however, you can use a comma as well. Examples:
- [12 24]
- [12, 24, 24, 12]

â– SET PADDINGS FOR A GROUP
1. Create a rectangle. This element will be the base of the component
2. Put some text or another shape inside the rectangle
3. Group these elements
4. Select the Group and whether rename the Group by adding e.g. [16 32] at the end of the name or just run Paddi to apply the default values - [12 24]
5. Change text or resize elements inside the Group
6. Select the Group and run Paddi again to apply the paddings

â– SET PADDINGS FOR A FRAME
1. Write some text or create a shape
2. Wrap it with a Frame
3. âš ï¸ In case you have only one element in the Frame the paddings will calculate from the Frame to its element. âš ï¸ In case you have more than 1 element inside the Frame and want to use this Frame as the base you need to wrap all its elements with a Group
4. Select the Frame and whether rename the Frame by adding e.g. [16 32] at the end of the name or just run Paddi to apply the default values - [12 24]
5. Change text or resize elements inside the Frame
6. Select the Frame and run Paddi again to apply the paddings

â– SET PADDINGS FOR A COMPONENT
1. After you have a Group with some paddings create a master component from it
2. Set constraints for the master component to make sure its instances will responsive correctly. Set Scale for the base and make sure all other elements have Left and Top
3. Change elements and run Paddi. âš ï¸ Because you canâ€™t change elements position in an instance you will be able to change only the text elements and then apply the paddings

â– IGNORE
To ignore some elements in your component, rename the necessary ones with [ignore] or [nopaddi] at the end of its name.

â– IMPORTANT TO KNOW
âš ï¸ The lowest element in a group or frame is going to be the base of the component! So don't forget to add a base.
âš ï¸ The base element in your component will be marked as (base) in the layer name.
âš ï¸ You canâ€™t change paddings for instance because you canâ€™t change its elements positioning. To handle it, go to the master component or detach the instance.
âš ï¸ If you want to set a Frame as a base and specify paddings for it, wrap all elements inside this frame in a group to have only one element in the frame and then apply Paddi.

â– WHERE TO USE
âœ… Buttons
âœ… Tab items
âœ… Navigation items
âœ… Dropdown menus
âœ… Tags / Pils / Badges
âœ… Tooltips / Popovers
âœ… Icons
âœ… UI Cards
âœ… Modal dialogs
âœ… Sections
âœ… Etc.

â– SHORTCUT FOR MAC OS
To speed up your workflow add a shortcut to Paddi. It takes a minute to set up but keeps a lot of time later on.
Open System Preferences -> Keyboard -> Shortcuts tab -> App Shortcuts -> Add new:
1. Application: Figma
2. Menu Title: Paddi
3. Keyboard shortcut: cmd+shift+P (You can use your own)

---

ðŸ˜Ž MADE BY
Oleksandr Telnov & Mikhail Voloshin at Dumka.io

Clicking on a layer will display that nodes properties and styles within the inspector panel.


Each property has a copy to clipboard button for finding the properties you need while working on your app.

21488.description:
Speed up plugin development with an easy way to view and explore node properties.


Clicking on a layer will display that nodes properties and styles within the inspector panel.


Each property has a copy to clipboard button for finding the properties you need while working on your app.


This plugin is aimed to save time when building and maintaining Figma plugins by allowing you to view properties that you would otherwise need to console.log


Have a question? DM me on Twitter

plugins.name: i18n
plugins.description:
No more manual text layer updates. Just drop your i18n JSON file and update text layers automatically.


How it works

  1. Name text layers with a dot-notation expression such as apps.welcome.title
  2. Start the plugin and drop or select your JSON file.
  3. Text layers with names that match whatâ€™s in the JSON file will automatically be updated.


The plugin only accepts the following JSON data structure:

{
  "apps": {
    "welcome": {
      "title": "Happy new year 2021",
      "subtitle": "No more manual text layer updates. Sync your design with your i18n automatically.",
      "cta": {
        "hook": "Miso is good for you.",
        "button": "START"
      }
    }
  }
}

plugins.name: Auto Layout Column Charts
plugins.description:
Auto layout Column Charts allows you to paste TSV data directly out of Google Sheets or Excel and turn it into a fully editable vertical bar chart, constructed using auto layout columns.


After pasting in your data, you'll see settings to assign columns in your data, set the width of your chart and the left margin (for bar labels), and turn on/off headers, values, and y axis ticks.


After running the plugin, you can move columns around using your arrow keys. You can also adjust colours, fonts, and sizes as you normally would in Figma.
plugins.tagline: Create vertical bar charts from your data using auto layout

plugins.name: Mockplus for Enterprise

Mockplus for Enterprise is a dedicated plugin for enterprises, organizations and teams to sync Figma designs, variants, assets, interactions and more details into Mockplus Enterprise version for further collaboration and handoff on their own internal server.

This powerful Mockplus Enterprise version is specially crafted for enterprises, companies, organizations and teams that need a more secure environment and something custom, allowing designers, developers, product managers and project managers to gather, review, discuss, collaborate and handoff their designs in one centralized space - of course under their own internal server.

plugins.name: Live Preview
plugins.description:
Easily share a live preview of your Figma prototype with others


Run the plugin to present a QR code for others to scan on their devices to view your prototype in realtime in their browser


Note:

- You'll need to change your prototype view & share settings accordingly to make sure that others are able to view it properly

- The reason you need to copy the share link to generate the QR code is that Figma doesn't allow plugins to access the file ID directly, which is necessary to load the prototype link


--- Live Preview does not store your share link ---

plugins.name: Photo Gradient
plugins.description:
Create stunning gradients either by hand or by using the colors from an image. Photo gradient makes it easy to grab the colors of a photo and turn it into a mesh gradient to use in your designs.


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Either upload/paste an image after hitting image icon
  3. OR select a frame/image with the target icon to use something already on your canvas
  4. Adjust the color placement
  5. Then play with the noise, warp, and color placements.


I was tired of gradient tools that weren't fun to use so I built one that others can use for free.


It's also available on the web at photogradient.com

plugins.name: Foundation: Icon Scaler
plugins.description:
Deliver Icons at a greater speed!


Foundation: Icon Scaler is a plugin that helps you and your team to optimize the icon creation workflow.


Create your base icon and scale to the other desired sizes in one single click with rules defined by you.


Settings can be shared and imported so you don't have to create them manually every time you run the plugin for the first time.


Features

Main features:

  • Component set generator
  • Flatten Icon Shapes
  • Crop Component Sets
  • Outline Stroke
  • Import and Export Settings
  • Bulk Icon creation
  • Lock layers and add background for better deep selection


Suggestions

If you have any suggestions/features/profiles you want to be added please send me an email to:

work@jorge-fernandes.com

accepted.name: Jorge Fernandes
accepted.description: Senior Product Designer at Revolut

plugins.name: Figma Asteroids
plugins.description:
Play Asteroids in Figma with friends! ðŸš€


To create a game, run this Plugin.


To join a game, run the Plugin while another game is running. The Plugin will automatically find and join a game if one exists in the same Figma file.


Cooperative game

Shoot down the asteroids with friends! You can copy+paste asteroids to increase difficulty. Try out these level ideas:

Level 1 (easy): 6 asteroids per player

Level 2 (medium): 10 asteroids per player

Level 3 (hard): 15 asteroids per player


Competitive game

Play multiplayer spaceship combat!

  1. Run Plugin
  2. Select all asteroids and delete them via Layers Panel
  3. Let players join game and spread out

Battle! Last team standing wins


Create custom worlds

To create your own worlds, create a Frame and place asteroids as direct children. When the first player goes to run the Plugin, if they have a Frame selected, the Plugin will run using that Frame instead of generating the default world


Get creative with your asteroid designs. Anything that's a direct child of the world is considered an asteroid (collision detection is done assuming all objects are circles, so you'll want to make them roughly circular)

accepted.description: Software Engineer @ Figma

Get creative with your asteroid designs. Anything that's a direct child of the world is considered an asteroid (collision detection is done assuming all objects are circles, so you'll want to make them roughly circular)

plugins.name: Color Kitchen
plugins.description:
Create recipes for working with colors, color variables and styles systematically, directly on the canvas where you can see what's happening.


Demo file


How to

  1. Run Create components to create a page with components needed for the Color Kitchen plugin
  2. Place instances of the Color Kitchen Recipe component on your canvas.
  3. Select a color, color variable or a color style as source by applying it to the first âšªï¸ Swatch Layer on the left side.
  4. Change the âš™ï¸ Modifier components and the modifiers ðŸŽš Value as you please. You can also detach the recipe to be able to move things around more freely within the recipe. Add as many âš™ï¸ Modifiers and âš™ï¸Color Swatches as you want.
  5. Select one or more recipes and Run recipes to see the modifiers changing all the color swatches on their right. Or run all recipes on the page by not selecting anything before running the command.
  6. If you want to link two or more variables or styles create or apply existing variables or styles to one or more âšªï¸ Swatch Layers on the right side.


Additional features

  1. Add âš™ï¸Print instances to the recipe to see color values, contrast ratios, variable and style names or descriptions printed on the canvas.
  2. Change the variant properties of âš™ï¸Color Swatch layers to override specific color values in styles with multiple fills, effects and gradients. You need to specify which of the effects, fills or color stops in a gradient you want to override by providing the coordinates as a number. 0 is the first fill/effect. In the case of gradients you need to provide two numbers, the number of the fill and the number of the color stop, like that: 0:1


Use cases

  1. Variation: Link multiple variables or styles with varying opacity or luminance to one main variable or style.
  2. Inheritance: I.e. link colors in shadows or gradients to your main color variables or styles.
  3. Exploration: Try different treatments and color models to create palettes.
  4. Documentation & Collaboration: Make color choices traceable and reproducible.
  5. Theming: Make all colors dependent on a few accent colors.


Available color transformations

  1. Brighten/darken
  2. Saturate/desaturate
  3. Channels: Set or modify a value of a single channel (i.e. red or hue or lightness)
  4. Opacity: Set or add to/subtract from opacity
  5. Luminance: Set to make contrasts work
  6. Mix two colors
  7. Blend two colors using different blend modes
  8. Contrast Minimum: Darken or brighten, until the given contrast ratio in relation to a given second color is met. (Ignores opacity)


Sources

  1. Most color functions are using chroma-js, check the docs for more information.
  2. Built with Create Figma Plugin by Yuan Qing Lim
  3. Node Decoder by Gavin Mc Farland was a huge help


Roadmap

  1. Modifiers to work with additional useful color models like HSLuv or Material Designs' HCT
  2. Generate new styles in addition to syncing existing ones
  3. Cooking with noodles: Use prototyping links or maybe FigJam's connectors to connect color swatches
  4. Add support for variables
  5. Additional guidance within the component descriptions.
  6. More comfortable ways to use a color for multiple shadows
  7. Add demo file
  8. Modifiers that ensure a certain contrast threshold minimum against a selected background color.
  9. Add label elements that print color values and style names to the canvas for readability

accepted.name: Richard Bruskowski
accepted.description:
Freelance Designer â€” 
Visual design, digital products, hi-fi prototypes, design systems, brand design.

plugins.name: Textâ€ºâ€ºhelper
plugins.description:
Mostly now native in Figma. Find, replace and insert text content and view the current selected character count.


Sometimes you have lots of text that repeats, and it's not part of a component/instance system. When you want to simply and easily replace the contents of each of those, you can quickly grab Textâ€ºâ€ºhelper to help you!


There's three main ways to replace something:

  1. Type text into the Find input, type replacement text in the Replace input and press "Find & Replace" (or hit enter) to replace everything that matches
  2. Select a single item to fill the Find input with that text value, type replacement text in the Replace input and press "Find & Replace" (or hit enter) to replace everything that matches
  3. Highlight multiple items, type a value in the Replace input and press "Replace only" (or hit enter) to replace everything within your current selection


You can also insert text before or after your selected strings, great for easily prepending or appending "-light" to your selection. And you can easily see the current selection(s) total character count.

plugins.name: Line Length
plugins.description:
Set your text layers width by the average number of characters per line!


Demo link: https://twitter.com/marceloblaz/status/1300432452247318529


New feature

With this last update, it is possible to also check the current Line Length of a given text layer! Check the demo: https://twitter.com/marceloblaz/status/1321561732268105729


One of the most useful ways to measure line length is by average characters per line. It's common practice to set the line length between 45â€“90 characters in order to have a nice reading flow.


With Line Length it will become a lot easier to find that sweet spot that will give your design a fine look and great readability.


This plugin works with mixed font text layers


Give feedback: https://forms.gle/D9UeBjHfYiukFLP89


Made by

Marcelo Brasileiro

Contribution

Caio Silva (@caiopesilva)

MindMaps are useful for: Brainstorming, Summarizing information, Summary paper (such as arxiv. org), Taking notes, Consolidating information from different sources, Thinking through complex problems, Presenting information clearly, Studying and memorizing information.


All data you upload are automatically deleted every day.

plugins.description:
The Supernova Figma Variables Sync plugin allows you to synchronize collections of variables and modes with your design system in Supernova.


When you push collections from Figma, they will be updated in Supernova, including any tokens referenced in your documentation (once you publish it again) or codebases with automatic pipelines.


Supernova Figma Variables Sync plugin is currently in public beta. If you find any issues, please reach out to us.

plugins.name: Missing Library Usage Finder
plugins.description:
Enter the name of the Component Instance or Style you want to look for and the plugin will search for it across all pages, resulting in a list of all finds that allows you to go to the finds and/or detach them individually.


Use Case 1: Remove missing libraries

  • View missing libraries via Assets > Library (Book Icon). You'll see Includes X missing libraries at the bottom when you have missing libraries, click it to view the components and styles in use from missing libraries. 
  • Open the Missing Library Usage Finder plugin, enter the names of the styles you want to search for, separated by line-breaks.
  • Press Search, note that this might take a while for larger design files.
  • If the plugin finds uses of the styles or components they get listed below and you can navigate to the find and/or unlink/detach it directly.


Use Case 2: Unlink unwanted library

  • Open unwanted library, e.g. via Assets > Library (Book Icon), then hover over the library name and click Open File. 
  • Once in the unwanted library open the Library Style Detail Extractor plugin and click Extract Names, and then Copy Names to Clipboard. 
  • Go back to the initial design file, open the Missing Library Usage Finder plugin
  • Paste the copied names and click Search. Note that this might take a while for larger design files.
  • If the plugin finds uses of the styles or components they get listed below and you can navigate to the find and/or unlink/detach it directly.


Plugin Source Code

This plugin is part of Radius, Rangle.io's Design System Accelerator.

You can find the source code on Github.

plugins.tagline: Figma Plugin to find instances or styles by name, e.g. to find missing or unwanted library usage.

62624.name: Missing Library Usage Finder
62624.description:
Enter the name of the Component Instance or Style you want to look for and the plugin will search for it across all pages, resulting in a list of all finds that allows you to go to the finds and/or detach them individually.


Use Case 1: Remove missing libraries

  • View missing libraries via Assets > Library (Book Icon). You'll see Includes X missing libraries at the bottom when you have missing libraries, click it to view the components and styles in use from missing libraries. 
  • Open the Missing Library Usage Finder plugin, enter the names of the styles you want to search for, separated by line-breaks.
  • Press Search, note that this might take a while for larger design files.
  • If the plugin finds uses of the styles or components they get listed below and you can navigate to the find and/or unlink/detach it directly.


Use Case 2: Unlink unwanted library

  • Open unwanted library, e.g. via Assets > Library (Book Icon), then hover over the library name and click Open File. 
  • Once in the unwanted library open the Library Style Detail Extractor plugin and click Extract Names, and then Copy Names to Clipboard. 
  • Go back to the initial design file, open the Missing Library Usage Finder plugin
  • Paste the copied names and click Search. Note that this might take a while for larger design files.
  • If the plugin finds uses of the styles or components they get listed below and you can navigate to the find and/or unlink/detach it directly.


Plugin Source Code

This plugin is part of Radius, Rangle.io's Design System Accelerator.

You can find the source code on Github.
62624.release_notes: New feature: "Detach All" button that detaches all search results.
62624.tagline: Figma Plugin to find instances or styles by name, e.g. to find missing or unwanted library usage.

plugins.name: Supa Snapshot
plugins.description:
Introducing Supa Snapshot: 

the ultimate tool for creating stunning snapshots instantly within Figma. Simply select one or more layers, and watch as the plugin quickly generates a high-quality snapshot.


One of the key features of this plugin is its ability to create reusable snapshots. Once you've made the perfect snapshot, you can save it and use it again and again in other designs. Sharing snapshots with others is also a breeze - simply export them as images or share them on social media.


The Figma Snapshot Plugin is designed to be user-friendly, with an intuitive interface that allows you to easily adjust and tweak your snapshots to perfection. 


Whether you're a seasoned designer or just starting out, this plugin will help you create stunning visuals in no time.

So why wait? Try out the Figma Snapshot Plugin today and take your design game to the next level!

plugins.name: Spacers
plugins.description:
Smarter Autolayouts with Spacers


> Add custom spaces between component

> Hide and show spacers in one clic

> Create new autolayouts in seconds

> Custom sizes

> Custom colors


A plugin by the UX 82 Team > Elsa, Arnaud, Bertrand, Christophe, Guillaume, Olivier


> Add custom spaces between component


Select the component where to add a spacer.

Choose your direction

Choose your spacer size

And the spacer is added to your design


> Hide and show spacers in one clic


Just switch to see spacers or not

The state is saved in the document so you can share it clean. Anyone with the plugin can show them back.


> Create new autolayouts in seconds


If you add a spacer in a direction that does not fit with the parent autolayout, Spacers plugin smartly adds you a new autolayout.


It also works with multi selection in a same frame : select at least the first and last element you need to move with a spacer and a inner autolayout will be created.

plugins.name: Inter Letter Spacing
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin will fix the letter spacing of selected text layers according to the Inter Dynamic Metrics.

Usage:

1. Select one or more text layers.
2. Run Inter Letter Spacing from the Plugins menu.

Any layers that don't use the Inter font will be left unchanged.

plugins.name: Figma Format
plugins.description:
Figma Format let's you format your canvas by grouping them by the 
 names.

â–  How it works
It will check the names of each layer and group them by the text before the separator (by default "/") and layout nicely by their groups.

â–  Customization
You can customize how you want to format your cavas.
- Spacing for X and Y axis
- Grouping seprator (by default "/")
- Vertical or Horizontal Layout

â–  Example
If we have 5 frames named the following
- "Article/List"
- "Article/List"
- "Account/My Page"
- "Account/Settings"
- "Account/Settings". 

And formats using this plugin, it will be layouted like this:

| Account/My Page | Account/Settings | Account/SettingsB |
| Article/Detail | Article/List |

â–  Feedback
If you have any feedback feel free to open an issue!
https://github.com/kawamurakazushi/figma-format/issues

â–  Project Roadmap
[x] Sort the Layers
[ ] Customization Options
  [x]  Spacing for x-axis and y-axis
  [x]  Separator (default is"/")
  [x]  Number of element in a row / column.
  [x]  Horizontal / Vertical 
  [ ]  Postion of the seprator, for grouping (default is 1)

â–  Support
Like on Figma, or Star on Github is always a motivation :D

https://github.com/kawamurakazushi/figma-format
